intro: Erigeron glabrifolius, commonly known as the plains fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron glabrifolius is often found in prairie ecosystems and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
